# __Design for Thought and Emotion__

[__Aristotelian reasoning__](Glossary.ipynb#aristotelian-reasoning) is a classical form of logical thinking developed by Aristotle that explains how we move from general principles to specific conclusions using structured logic.

Aristotelian reasoning is [__deductive reasoning__](Glossary.ipynb#deductive-reasoning)based on __syllogisms__â€”formal arguments where a conclusion necessarily follows from two premises.


While conscious [__Aristotelian reasoning__](Glossary.ipynb#aristotelian-reasoning)  This content is hidden by default reasoning is the most apparent aspect of our thought process, subconscious thought has a vital role to play.
